content:
NameValueConfigurationCollection Class

In this Article

Contains a collection of NameValueConfigurationElement objects. This class cannot be inherited.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Configuration.ConfigurationCollection(typeof(System.Configuration.NameValueConfigurationElement))]
public sealed class NameValueConfigurationCollection : System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ConfigurationElement
  • System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection
  • NameValueConfigurationCollection

Remarks

The NameValueConfigurationCollection class allows you to programmatically access a collection of NameValueConfigurationElement objects.

Constructors summary

NameValueConfigurationCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the NameValueConfigurationCollection class.

Properties summary

AllKeys

Gets the keys to all items contained in the NameValueConfigurationCollection.
Item(String)

Gets or sets the NameValueConfigurationElement object based on the supplied parameter.
Properties

Methods summary

Adds a NameValueConfigurationElement object to the collection.

Clears the NameValueConfigurationCollection.

Removes a NameValueConfigurationElement object from the collection based on the provided parameter.

Constructors

  • NameValueConfigurationCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the NameValueConfigurationCollection class.

    public NameValueConfigurationCollection ();

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the NameValueConfigurationCollection constructor. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NameValueConfigurationCollection class. 

                    // Create a NameValueConfigurationCollection object.
                NameValueConfigurationCollection myNameValConfigCollection =
                  new NameValueConfigurationCollection();

                    ' Create a NameValueConfigurationCollection object.
                Dim myNameValConfigCollection As New NameValueConfigurationCollection()

Properties

  • AllKeys

    Gets the keys to all items contained in the NameValueConfigurationCollection.

    public string[] AllKeys { get; }

    Property Value

    • String[]

      A string array.

  • Item(String)

    Gets or sets the NameValueConfigurationElement object based on the supplied parameter.

    public System.Configuration.NameValueConfigurationElement this[string name] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the NameValueConfigurationElement contained in the collection.

    Property Value

    • NameValueConfigurationElement

      A NameValueConfigurationElement object.

    Remarks

    Use the Item property to get or set a NameValueConfigurationElement object based on the name parameter.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the Item property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NameValueConfigurationCollection class. 

                    // Item property.
                Console.WriteLine("Value of property 'enabled': {0}",
                 myNameValConfigCollection["enabled"].Value);

                    ' Item property.
                Console.WriteLine("Value of property 'enabled': {0}", myNameValConfigCollection("enabled").Value)
  • Properties
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationPropertyCollection Properties { get; }

    Property Value

    • ConfigurationPropertyCollection

      To be added.

Methods

  • Add(NameValueConfigurationElement)

    Adds a NameValueConfigurationElement object to the collection.

    public void Add (System.Configuration.NameValueConfigurationElement nameValue);

    Parameters

    • nameValue
      NameValueConfigurationElement

      A NameValueConfigurationElement object.

    Remarks

    Use the Add method to add a new NameValueConfigurationElement object to the collection.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the Add method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NameValueConfigurationCollection class. 

                    foreach (PropertyInformation propertyItem in
                  configSection.ElementInformation.Properties)
                {
                    // Assign  domain name.
                    if (propertyItem.Name == "domain")
                        propertyItem.Value = "MyDomain";

                    if (propertyItem.Value != null)
                    {
                        // Enable SSL for cookie exchange.
                        if (propertyItem.Name == "cookieRequireSSL")
                            propertyItem.Value = true;

                        NameValueConfigurationElement nameValConfigElement =
                            new NameValueConfigurationElement
                                (propertyItem.Name.ToString(), propertyItem.Value.ToString());

                        // Add a NameValueConfigurationElement
                        // to the collection.
                        myNameValConfigCollection.Add(nameValConfigElement);
                       
                    }
                }

                    For Each propertyItem As PropertyInformation In configSection.ElementInformation.Properties
                    ' Assign  domain name.
                    If propertyItem.Name = "domain" Then
                        propertyItem.Value = "MyDomain"
                    End If

                    If propertyItem.Value <> Nothing Then
                        ' Enable SSL for cookie exchange.
                        If propertyItem.Name = "cookieRequireSSL" Then
                            propertyItem.Value = True
                        End If

                        Dim nameValConfigElement As New NameValueConfigurationElement(propertyItem.Name.ToString(), propertyItem.Value.ToString())

                        ' Add a NameValueConfigurationElement
                        ' to the collection.

                        myNameValConfigCollection.Add(nameValConfigElement)
                    End If
                Next
  • Clear()

    Clears the NameValueConfigurationCollection.

    public void Clear ();

    Remarks

    When the Clear method is called, it removes all NameValueConfigurationElement objects from the collection.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the Clear method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NameValueConfigurationCollection class. 

                    // Clear the collection.
                myNameValConfigCollection.Clear();

                    ' Clear the collection.
  • CreateNewElement()
    protected override System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement CreateNewElement ();

    Returns

    • ConfigurationElement

      To be added.

  • GetElementKey(ConfigurationElement)

    Parameters

    • element
      ConfigurationElement

      To be added.

    Returns

    • Object

      To be added.

  • Remove(NameValueConfigurationElement)

    Removes a NameValueConfigurationElement object from the collection based on the provided parameter.

    public void Remove (System.Configuration.NameValueConfigurationElement nameValue);

    Parameters

    • nameValue
      NameValueConfigurationElement

      A NameValueConfigurationElement object.

    Remarks

    Use the Remove method to remove a NameValueConfigurationElement from the collection. Override in a derived class if custom behavior is required when the element is removed.

    Example

    The following code example demonstrates how to use the Remove method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the NameValueConfigurationCollection class. 

                    // Remove domain from the collection.
                NameValueConfigurationElement myConfigElement =
                    myNameValConfigCollection["domain"];
                // Remove method.
                myNameValConfigCollection.Remove(myConfigElement);

                    ' Remove domain from the collection.
                Dim myConfigElement As NameValueConfigurationElement = myNameValConfigCollection("domain")
                ' Remove method.
                myNameValConfigCollection.Remove(myConfigElement)
  • Remove(String)

    Removes a NameValueConfigurationElement object from the collection based on the provided parameter.

    public void Remove (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the NameValueConfigurationElement object.

    Remarks

    Use the Remove method to remove a NameValueConfigurationElement from the collection. Override in a derived class if custom behavior is required when the element is removed.
